articles.title: Greetings to President of Sao Tome and Principe
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Sao Tome and Principe
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Manuel Pinto Da Costa, president of the Democratic Republic of Sao Tome and Principe, on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of its independence and proclamation of the republic.
					 The message expressed belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in mutual interests.

articles.title: Lao High-ranking Military Delegation Pays Homage to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Lao High-ranking Military Delegation Pays Homage to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- A Lao high-ranking military delegation led by Minister of Defence Sengnouane Sayalat, secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, Sunday visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun.
					 They paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues.
					
					 At the halls where the President and Kim Jong Il lie in state the guests paid homage to them.
					
					 They looked round the halls where the orders the great leaders received are on display and halls which house cars, an electric car, a boat and train coaches they used during field guidance and foreign tour till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Lao High-ranking Military Delegation Lays Wreath before Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong
articles.content:
Lao High-ranking Military Delegation Lays Wreath before Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- A Lao high-ranking military delegation led by Minister of Defence Sengnouane Sayalat, secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, Sunday laid a wreath before the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong.
					 Members of the delegation placed bouquets before the bust of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk and observed a moment's silence in memory of her.
					
					 A wreath was laid before the cemetery in the name of the delegation.
					
					 The guests observed a moment's silence in memory of the revolutionary martyrs.
					
					 Then they went round the cemetery.

articles.title: MOU Signed between DPRK State General Bureau of Tourism and WTO
articles.content:
MOU Signed between DPRK State General Bureau of Tourism and WTO
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- A MOU between the State General Bureau of Tourism of the DPRK and the World Tourism Organization (WTO) was signed here Sunday.
					 Present at the signing ceremony were General Director Jo Song Gol and other officials of the general bureau, officials concerned and members of a delegation of WTO led by Secretary-General Taleb Rifai.
					
					 Jo Song Gol and Taleb Rifai inked the MOU.

articles.title: Minju Joson Denounces U.S., S. Korea for Pulling up Pyongyang Bio-technical Institute
articles.content:
Minju Joson Denounces U.S., S. Korea for Pulling up Pyongyang Bio-technical Institute
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) --- The U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces conspired with each other in groundlessly terming the Pyongyang Bio-technical Institute an anthrax germ production base, another unpardonable provocation against the DPRK.
					 Minju Joson Sunday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 As widely known at home and abroad the institute is developing efficacious bio-agricultural chemicals urgently needed for agricultural production, animal husbandry, pomiculture, horticulture and afforestation in the 21st century.
					
					 Its products are highly estimated for doing no harm to human body, soil and ecological environment, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 If production processes for agrochemicals are just the same as those for anthrax germs as claimed by the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces, so many institutes for bio-agricultural chemicals in many countries must be facilities for anthrax germs. Is this claim reasonable?
					
					 They are under-wits suffering from mental derangement as they are abusing the progress of the times and products of scientific and technological development for attaining their sinister purposes.
					
					 Lurking behind that absurd assertion is the U.S. black-hearted scenario to divert elsewhere the public opinion at home and abroad critical of it for its recent introduction of live anthrax germs in its military bases in south Korea and their experiments to apply them into an actual war.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is the behavior of the puppet group dancing to the tune of the U.S.
					
					 It is the tragedy for the Korean nation that such traitors are now allowed to remain members of the same nation. It is no more than a day dream for the U.S. and the puppet forces to try to tarnish the image of the dignified DPRK with such rhetoric and invectives.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Denounces U.S. Moves for THAAD Deployment
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Denounces U.S. Moves for THAAD Deployment
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea met in Seoul on July 9 to lash out at the U.S. moves for deploying THAAD in south Korea, a factor of increasing the danger of a war on the Korean peninsula.
					 The organization referred to the fact that the U.S. assistant secretary of State made a trip to south Korea that day. 
					
					 It accused him of asserting that THAAD is "a decisive force to cope with missiles from the north."
					
					 THAAD deployment in south Korea would escalate military conflict among neighboring countries and lay hurdles in the way of peace and reunification on the Korean peninsula, it held.
					
					 Noting that the "government" should disallow THAAD deployment if it truly stands for peace, the organization declared that it would wage actions against its deployment.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan, Japanese Demand Application of Tuition-free Program to Korean Schools
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan, Japanese Demand Application of Tuition-free Program to Korean Schools
 Tokyo, July 11 (KNS-KCNA) -- A demonstration took place outside the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan in Tokyo on July 10 to demand the application of tuition-free program for senior high schools to Korean schools.
					 Present there were officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), officials of its organizations and enterprises, teachers and students of Korean University and Korean high schools, parents of students, Koreans in Japan and officials of Japanese civic organizations including the representative of the Liaison Council Opposing Exclusion of Korean School from Tuition-free Program for Senior High Schools.
					
					 In the demo speakers said the Japanese government's discriminating policy toward Korean schools is not only an unbearable violation of the rights of Koreans in Japan but also a breach of the Japanese Constitution.
					
					 It is also an act of going against the era, they charged.
					
					 That day the Liaison Council of Graduates from Korean High Schools and the Liaison Council of Societies of Mothers of Korean Schools submitted a written request addressed to the Japanese prime minister and the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology of Japan.
					
					 In the request the organizations demanded an immediate cancellation of the discriminating policy toward the students of the Korean schools.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered by Koreans in Kyrgyzstan
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Remembered by Koreans in Kyrgyzstan
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- A meeting to remember President Kim Il Sung was held by the United Confederation of Koreans in Kyrgyzstan at the Korean Center in Bishkek on the occasion of the 21st anniversary of his demise.
					 Displayed at the venue of the meeting were photos documenting immortal revolutionary career of the President.
					
					 Present there were Chairman Pak Kyong Ho and officials of the confederation and other Koreans in Kyrgyzstan.
					
					 Its participants laid a floral basket and bouquets before the portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Pak Kyong Ho said in his speech that the whole life of the President was one of a great revolutionary who dedicated himself to the sacred cause for the country and its people.
					
					 Our compatriots are convinced that thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un the revolutionary cause of the great Generalissimos is being successfully carried forward and the cause of reunifying Korea and building a thriving socialist nation will surely be accomplished, he stressed.
					
					 Its participants looked round the photos dealing with the sacred revolutionary career of the President.

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung by Foreign Personages
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung by Foreign Personages
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Delegates of political parties, organizations and institutions and personages of various circles of different countries visited the DPRK embassies in their countries from July 6 to 8 to observe the 21st anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They laid floral baskets and bouquets before portraits of the smiling President and leader Kim Jong Il and full-length paintings depicting them and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Visitors included personages and members of the Communist Party of Bangladesh, Bangladesh People's League, Workers' Party of Bangladesh, Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee, Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea, Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy, Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist), Nepal-Korea Friendship Association, Nepal Journalist Association, Nepal Institute for the Juche Studies, Study Forum for Self-Reliance of Nepal, Nepali Literary Forum for the Study of Songun Politics, Nepalese Committee for Promotion of Reunification of Korea, Myanmar Medical Research Institute, Communist Party of Peru (Red Motherland), Communist Party of Peru, Peruvian National Independent Movement for Free Voting's Union, Peruvian Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, Socialist Political Action Party of Peru, Kim Jong Suk Library in Peru, Peruvian People's Women Union, Peru-Korea Friendship Institute for Study of 
					
					 the Juche Based Songun Policy and the Peru-Korea Institute of Culture and Friendship, and the wife of the Nigerian president and the special assistant to the president.
					
					 The Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar, the co-chairman of the Council of the Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation, the general director of the Golden Trip Travel Service Co. Ltd., Hong Kong, China, the chairperson of the Emperor Group of Hong Kong, China and the chief secretary of the Zhonghwa Energy Fund Commission sent floral baskets to the DPRK missions in their countries.

articles.title: 10Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Sweden
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Sweden
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and Our People" was brought out in pamphlet by the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association and the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					 The work published on April 20, Juche 101 (2012) deals with the revolutionary exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il during their whole life.
					
					 It also indicates the tasks for firmly upholding the ideas and exploits of the President and Kim Jong Il and adding shine to them forever.
					
					 A book-releasing ceremony took place in Stockholm on July 7.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Lauded by Swedish Figure
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Lauded by Swedish Figure
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung was the most prominent leader of the 20th century and a peerlessly great man who performed undying exploits for the Korean revolution and the global cause of independence against imperialism.
					 Christer Lundgren, chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, said this in his speech at a releasing ceremony of supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work held in Stockholm on July 7.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The Sweden-Korea Friendship Association and the Swedish Group for the Study of the Juche Idea translated and published Kim Jong Un's work on the occasion of the 21st anniversary of demise of the President.
					
					 Though the President passed away, his great revolutionary career and undying feats are always remembered by the Korean people and world progressives.
					
					 It is great honor and due obligation for us, the close friends of the Korean people, to publish Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and Our People."
					
					 We will as ever extend positive support to the Korean people in their just struggle for dynamically pushing forward the building of a thriving socialist nation, united close around Kim Jong Un who is successfully carrying forward the great idea and revolutionary exploits of the President and leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Remembered in Foreign Countries
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings took place in India, Kyrgyzstan and Angola from July 3 to 7 on the occasion of the 21st anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 A member of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) who doubles as secretary general of the All India Indo-Korean Friendship Association and other speakers said that the President founded the Juche idea, thus clearly indicating the road to be followed by humankind.
					
					 They stressed that the President would always be alive in the hearts of all people as he ushered in the era of independence and devoted himself to the victory of the human cause of independence.
					
					 The chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgyz El" Republican Political Party of Kyrgyzstan said:
					
					 The President is always alive in the hearts of not only the Korean people but also the world progressives.
					
					 He successfully embodied the Juche idea, thus turning the DPRK into a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence and devoted himself to the people's happiness.

articles.title: Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Observed in Russia
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Observed in Russia
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- A Korean photo, book and art exhibition took place with due ceremony in Chita City, Russia and round-table talks in Nakhodka City on July 7 on the occasion of the 21st anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 On display at the venue of the exhibition were photos documenting immortal exploits of the President, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were their works, photos and books introducing Songun Korea and art pieces associated with the talents of the Korean people.
					
					 A vice-minister of the Ministry of Culture of the Zabaikal Territory Administration said he was pleased to see the opening of the exhibition introducing the DPRK dynamically advancing under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Noting that the exhibition would help Russian people have better understanding of the reality of the DPRK, he stressed that he would make positive contribution to the development of the traditional Russia-DPRK friendly relations through closer cultural exchange with the DPRK.
					
					 The representative of the Foreign Ministry in Chita City said that the President and Kim Jong Il were the world elder statesmen who made great contributions to the development of the Russia-DPRK friendly relations.
					
					 The secretary of the Regional Political Council of the Nakhodka City Branch of the Maritime Territory of the United Russia Party said that the President was the founder of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK and the great man who turned the DPRK into a socialist power.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits and Traits Lauded by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits and Traits Lauded by Foreign Newspapers
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers dedicated special write-ups to the 21st anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung on July 6.
					 The Malaysian paper Guang Ming Daily edited an article titled "Maker of history of new Korea" illustrated with a portrait of the smiling President.
					
					 The paper said:
					
					 The President created the new history of Korea.
					
					 HeKim Il Sung, the founding father of socialist Korea, devoted himself to the people's happiness.
					
					 He founded the Juche idea in the early period of his revolutionary struggle. He pushed forward the revolution and construction by relying on the strength of the Korean people.
					
					 The banner of self-reliance held high by him serves as a powerful weapon helping the Korean people achieve the country's prosperity century after century.
					
					 The Tanzanian paper Uhuru allotted one whole page to a special write-up titled "Eternal sun of Juche" illustrated with a photo of the President among service personnel of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 The paper in an article titled "Great career of President Kim Il Sung" introduced the exploits performed by him for the Korean revolution and the human cause of independence.
					
					 The Nigerian paper Nigerian Observer in an article titled "Kim Il Sung and his benevolent image" praised him for taking care of all people with his inborn love for the people.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits for Global Cause of Independence Lauded by Foreign Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits for Global Cause of Independence Lauded by Foreign Organizations
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Nigerian and Swiss organizations posted articles on their websites on the occasion of the 21st anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism edited articles titled "For global independence" and "Kim Il Sung, model of internationalists" on June 23 and 28.
					
					 Articles recalled that the President advanced the idea of global independence and positively encouraged the peoples of the countries aspiring after independence against imperialism in their struggle for national liberation.
					
					 Referring to the fact that he paid deep attention to the development of the world socialist movement, they stressed that the exploits he performed for the global independence would shine long.
					
					 The Switzerland-Korea Committee on June 29 carried the following article to praise the President for making great contributions on behalf of the times and history:
					
					 Kim Il Sung, the tender-hearted father of the people, benefactor of national liberation and national hero, devoted himself to liberating the country from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule and accomplishing the cause of national reunification.
					
					 He is always alive in the hearts of humankind as a pioneer of the global cause of independence and defender of the socialist cause.

articles.title: DPRK's Significant Days to Be Celebrated in Tanzania
articles.content:
DPRK's Significant Days to Be Celebrated in Tanzania
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- A Tanzanian preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of Korea's liberation and founding of the Workers' Party of Korea was inaugurated in Dar-Es-Salaam on July 4.
					 The secretary general of the Tanzania-DPRK Friendship Association was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize various political and cultural events to praise the exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un on the DPRK's significant days.

articles.title: Party-building Exploits of Kim Il Sung Praised in Germany
articles.content:
Party-building Exploits of Kim Il Sung Praised in Germany
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- The undying exploits President Kim Il Sung performed by founding the first party organization with the Juche idea as its guiding principle in the history of the Korean people's revolutionary struggle are shining along with the history of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 This was noted in an article posted by the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany on its website on July 3 on the occasion of the 21st anniversary of demise of the President and the 85th anniversary of the founding of the first party organization - the society for rallying comrades.
					
					 The article titled "First party organization - society for rallying comrades" said:
					
					 The first party organization, the seed of the WPK, was formed in 1930.
					
					 At the historic Kalun Meeting on June 30, 1930 the President advanced the unique policy on forming basic party organizations before anything else and founding a party next by ceaselessly expanding such organizations.
					
					 He chaired a meeting for forming the first party organization on July 3.
					
					 In the historic speech "On Occasion of Forming Party Organization" he called for rapidly expanding basic party organizations, establishing a unified system for guiding them and laying a firm revolutionary foundation.
					
					 Underlining the need to firmly adhere to an independent stand in all activities and conduct the work for building the party organization in close combination with the anti-Japanese struggle, he decided to call the organization the society for rallying comrades.
					
					 Since the foundation of the first party organization, the Korean revolution could advance along a new road under the unified guidance of the Juche-based revolutionary party organization.
					
					 This was a historic event that brought about a revolutionary turn in the work for laying an organizational and ideological groundwork for founding a party as it was a precious success made in the struggle of young revolutionaries for founding a new type revolutionary party.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Venezuelan, Mexican Bodies
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Venezuelan, Mexican Bodies
 Pyongyang, July 12 (KCNA) -- Venezuelan and Mexican bodies released bulletins to observe the 21st anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The Venezuelan National Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Venezuelan Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and the Venezuela-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association in their joint bulletin on July 6 edited an article illustrated with a portrait of the smiling President, which said:
					
					 The President liberated the country through a hard-fought anti-Japanese armed struggle, founded the party and state, led the Fatherland Liberation War, post-war rehabilitation and construction and socialist revolution and construction to victories and thus turned the DPRK into a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence. 
					
					 He sincerely helped developing countries in their struggle for achieving national independence and building new society and made great contributions to accomplishing the global cause of independence.
					
					 He was an incarnation of benevolent politics as he ardently loved the people, regarding them as the dearest, and the most prominent leader in the 20 century, a peerlessly great man and a great sage of mankind.
					
					 The Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and the Mexican Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in their bulletins on July 3 carried articles titled "Eternal President of DPRK Comrade Kim Il Sung" and "Great President Kim Il Sung and Juche idea".
